intro: Microcharis tritoides subsp. tritoides, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is a small, yellowish berry that ripens in the fall. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
